fields.description:
As a user I should be able to add notes to GitHub, and the DVCS connector would make updates to the JIRA issue. 

One common scenario is:

1. Make a commit in GitHub, and the developer forgets to enter the the JIRA issue in the comment.
2. DVCS scans the commits and doesn't add the commit to the JIRA issue because there was no issue entered in the GitHub comment.
3. The developer goes back to GitHub, and adds a comment/note with the JIRA issue.
4. DVCS should scan subsequent comment/notes and add a commit to the JIRA issue.
fields.summary: As a user I should be able to add notes to GitHub, and the DVCS connector would make updates to the JIRA issue

fields.description:
Merge commits could contain multiple issue keys from the branch being merged. This would affect the association of pull request to issue when merging from the target branch into the source branch.

As a workaround, we will exclude merge commits from the calculation of association of issues with pull requests from Bitbucket and GitHub. Any merge commits as part of a PR will be ignored, thus the issue keys mentioned in the commit messages of those merge commits will not be considered.
fields.summary: Stop associating PRs with Issues based on merge commits
As an Admin I want to create Reviewer accounts

fields.description:
Smart commits are supported in OnDemand for subversion commits only: http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=253231632 using http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Using+Smart+Commits

It would be great to have this functionality for Bitbucket and GitHub repositories.
fields.summary: As a developer I would like to transition issues with smart commits
As an Admin I want to create Writer accounts
As a writer I want to create multiple articles so that they can be published
As an Admin I want to be able to assign roles

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

_For reference, see DCON-211, DCON-424, DCON-708 please_

After the Github API rate limit resumes, the DVCS connector seems to start its sync algorithm from scratch. It always restarts with repo #1, and repo #2 thru #12 get continually starved.

I can manually restart the sync process on each repo and often clear things up but it be better for the DVCS connector to handle that more gracefully.

h3. Suggested Solution

Change the order in which repos are synchronized at the start of a sync cycle.  If the sync algorithm just resumed syncing from the "most stale repo" (or even just a round-robin scheduled), then organizations like ours would remain "eventually in sync" without manual intervention.

Perhaps a useful logic change might be to remember the repo that was last rate-limited and resume syncing with that repo once the quiet time has expired?

This sort of round-robin syncing might be a bit more robust. Another alternative would be to start syncing the repo with the oldest known successful sync time (ie. start with the repo known to be most out-of-date). Either behaviour would be preferable to how it currently works.

DVCS orders its repos alphabetically, and luck has it that our most active repo happens to start with the letter "A" ("App1"). So it always gets synced first each hour. But my current team is working on a repo at the end of the alphabet ("Web2") and its JIRA integration is getting completely starved by this rate-limit-sync bug.
fields.summary: Sync Logic Order > Detect and Sync by Most Stale Repo

fields.description:
After a long researching session attempting to understand why my team's smart commits where inconsistently showing, I finally figured out that there is a scheduler who's default is set to 60-minute intervals for syncing. Is it possible for that interval to be set to 30 minutes? I understand that takes more server power, but I have seen many people asking for shorter times as well and think it would greatly benefit the community. I understand that this power is given to those who host JIRA on their own, but unfortunately that's not an option for my team and I don't believe we're the only ones.

Thanks for your consideration.
fields.summary: Please allow shorter time interval for JIRA DVCS repo sync

fields.description:
see https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACLOUD/Getting+started+with+Bitbucket+and+JIRA+Cloud#GettingstartedwithBitbucketandJIRACloud-linkrepobbProceduretolinkanAccount - specifically step #3 of 'Step 2. Link the account on JIRA'.

This needs to be updated, as the DVCS config in JIRA is now located under Applications >> DVCS Accounts.
fields.summary: DVCS Config doc on CAC needs to be updated with new location of DVCS config.

fields.description:
There are 3 cases that exhibit this behaviour:
# Deleting a repo while it is being synced
# Syncing a repo while it is being deleted.
# Sync a repo after it has been deleted.

The following repo steps are for the simplest case #3 above:
- Create project "QA"
- Add 3 issues to project "QA"
- Add public repo: "https://github.com/farmas/TestRepo-QA" 
- Open a new browser window and navigate to configure repositories page.
- Delete the repo in one of the browser windows.
- On the other window, click on Force Sync

*Expected*: a) Error message stating that the repo has been removed, b) no op

*Actual*: Sync finished normally, commit results are displayed in the summary. If navigating to issues, under the github tab the commits are shown. However, the repo has been removed from the list.
fields.summary: If delete and sync operations happen concurrently, plugin leaves orphaned commits present on issues that are no longer removable.

fields.description:
Screen video: http://screencast.com/t/ld4eMawE 
	
- Create project "QA"
- Add 3 issues to project "QA"
- Add public repo: "https://github.com/farmas/TestRepo-QA" 
- Add public repo: "https://github.com/farmas/TestRepo-QA-TST" 
- Open a new browser window and navigate to configure repositories page.
- Browser window A, delete "TestRepo-QA"
- Browser window B, immediately afterwards delete TestRepo-QA-TST"
- Browser window B, notice that the removal of TestRepo-QA-TST finished first (smaller repo)
- Browser window A, removal of TestRepo-QA finishes second and is removed from llist
- Reload the configurations page

*Expected*: Both repos to be gone.
	
*Actual*: TestRepo-QA-TST is back on the list.
fields.summary: Deleting two repos concurrently, leaves the first to finish in the list of active repos

fields.description:
- Create project "QA" and "TST"
- Add 1 issue to each project
- Open a new browser window and navigate to configure repositories page.
- Add public repo "https://github.com/farmas/TestRepo-QA" on both clients at the same time (as close together as possible)

*Expected*: a) Both repos to complete their syncs with the same commit counts, b) Second add to fail stating that there is already a sync operation under way.
	
*Actual*: The commit counts are incorrect.
fields.summary: Incorrect commit count when adding the same repository on two clients at the same time.

fields.description:
- Create project "QA"
- Add 3 issues to project "QA"
- Add public repo: "https://github.com/farmas/TestRepo-QA"
- Open a new browser window and navigate to configure repositories page.
- Delete the repo on one window and immediately sync the repo on the other.

Expected: Error message stating that operation cannot be completed while deleting is preformed

Actual: PropertyImplementationException surfaces to the client.

Note: This is similar to https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/GHC-94, however notice that the stack trace is originating from a different point within the plugin.
fields.summary: Sync while repo is being deleted throws unhandled exception.

fields.description:

*Expected*: Error message stating that operation cannot be completed while syncing is preformed

*Actual*: PropertyImplementationException surfaces to the client.

fields.description:
An user report not able to connect to Github and getting the following error message:

"Invalid user/team account"

After do some testing, it seem the DVCS Connector Plugin version is not compatible with JIRA 6.

*Finding:*
* User has small instance.
* JIRA 6 running DVCS Connector Plugin version 1.3.1.


*Workaround:*
* Install the latest DVCS Connector Plugin version via https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-bitbucket-connector-plugin
fields.summary: Cannot connect to Github due of incompatible version of dvcs connector plugin in JIRA 6

I have a DVCS connector working against GitHub.  While one of my working repositories is syncing fine, and commit messages are working, others do not. 

I cannot disable the repository either,  I receive this error message:

Please contact the server administrator.

fields.description:
When viewing the commit details for an issue if the database that JIRA is installed on is an Oracle database then the file details for the commit are not cached.

This means that the details panel is slower to load on Oracle databases and there may be occasional timeouts if there are a large number of issue keys to retrieve.
fields.summary: Commit details are not cached when using an Oracle database

fields.description: Git commit messages are displayed without line breaks. This can seriously degrade the readability of the messages.
fields.summary: git commit messages are displayed without line breaks

The account is titled middlewareAdmin but the configuration has it set up as middlewareadmin. This means an extra redirect has to occur to get to the bitbucket account, which may be throwing a spanner in the works. I've set the account to be middlewareAdmin in the database, but this gets set back when visiting the 'Manage DVCS Connector' page.
fields.summary: Hitting 'Refresh List' for BitBucket repository throws stack trace

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Certain databases and repository sizes cause the JIRA Agile backlog pain to take 30 seconds to load.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Restore specific backup of instance that meets the size.
# Access the issue pane by clicking on an issue.

h3. Expected Results

The pane loads at normal speed.

h3. Actual Results

The pane takes up to 30 seconds to appear.

h3. Workaround

Disabling the *dvcs-commits-greenhopper-tab* module in the DVCS plugin effectively works around this. It does mean commits will not be displayed in the issue pane.

fields.description:
# Open up JIRA in OnDemand under IE8 with Tempo.
# Goto view issue types in admin screen. Tempo will start throwing JS errors like this:

{code}
Webpage error details

User Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 5.1; Trident/4.0; .NET CLR 1.1.4322; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.0.4506.2152; .NET CLR 3.5.30729; .NET4.0C; .NET4.0E)
Timestamp: Mon, 5 Aug 2013 08:21:38 UTC

Message: 'jira.app.fragments' is null or not an object
Line: 9751
Char: 14209
Code: 0
URI: https://mrbain.jira-dev.com/s/d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e/en_UKbxjgjb-1988229788/6138/13/c0d6085ccae59a318bf2843d51135e90/_/download/contextbatch/js/atl.admin/batch.js
{code}

This problem is that there is a bug in IE8 which causes your soy declaration of {namespace jira.dvcs.connector.plugin.soy} to overwrite the the jira global object. Can you consider moving this declaration into your own namespace (no need to use jira).
fields.summary: DVCS connector causing JS error in JIRA admin under IE8.

fields.description:
When commit message contains multiple issues, the smart commit will be executed multiple times. 

For example message "JRA-123 JRA-234 #resolve #comment Task completed #time 3h" will result in 
* logging 6 hours against issue JRA-123 and another 6 hours against JRA-234
* two comments on JRA-123 saying "Task completed" and two comments on JRA-234 saying "Task completed"
 

This is because we have separate database row per every issue key within the same commit.
fields.summary: Smart commits duplicate comments and worklogs in JIRA

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-14312].
  {panel}

When synchronizing GitHub, the DVCS Accounts show "Sync Failed: Error during sync. See server logs":

!dvcs-sync-error.png!

In the server log, there is:
{noformat}
2014-10-13 09:31:33.264521500 2014-10-13 09:31:33,263 DVCSConnector.MessageExecutor:thread-1 ERROR ServiceRunner     [dvcs.service.message.MessageConsumer] Synchronization failed: null
2014-10-13 09:31:33.264523500 java.lang.NullPointerException
2014-10-13 09:31:33.264523500 	at java.util.AbstractCollection.addAll(AbstractCollection.java:303)
2014-10-13 09:31:33.264524500 	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.sync.GitHubPullRequestPageMessageConsumer.onReceive(GitHubPullRequestPageMessageConsumer.java:109)
2014-10-13 09:31:33.264524500 	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.sync.GitHubPullRequestPageMessageConsumer.onReceive(GitHubPullRequestPageMessageConsumer.java:29)
2014-10-13 09:31:33.264534500 	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.service.MessageExecutor$MessageRunnable.doRun(MessageExecutor.java:361)
2014-10-13 09:31:33.264535500 	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.service.MessageExecutor$ReleaseTokenAndEnqueueNextMessage.run(MessageExecutor.java:267)
2014-10-13 09:31:33.264535500 	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:886)
2014-10-13 09:31:33.264537500 	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908)
2014-10-13 09:31:33.264537500 	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662)
{noformat}

*UPDATE* this is a bug in synchronization of GitHub/GitHub Enterprise pull requests during a full synchronization and when there are more than 30 pull requests in a repository. Commits and branches are not affected. 

*Impact* Only the oldest (by creation time) 30 pull requests in the affected repository will be synchronized. Any pull requests newer than the oldest 30 that are not updated after the time that the full sync (or first adding the GitHub account into JIRA) will not be synchronized. Any pull requests that have been changed since the full sync, regardless of whether they are among of the oldest 30, will be synchronized during a subsequent soft sync.

*Workaround* start a soft sync (just clicking on the sync icon). This would synchronize changes in the pull requests.
fields.summary: NullPointerException when synchronizing GitHub

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-14308].
  {panel}

On the DVCS Accounts page, linking a unlinked repo results in the following error:

The corresponding GitHub repo is public.

There is an NPE in the server log:

fields.summary: Unable to link selected repository - NullPointerException linking GitHub repositories

fields.description: Prior to using smart commit comment directives, our repository had no problem syncing. Since then, the dvcs cannot sync our bitbucket repository.
fields.summary: JIRA onDemand Sync Failed: Error during sync. See server logs.

fields.description:
We are using Bitbucket as our repository and paying for Jira Agile (in the cloud). We have OAuth credentials set up to link the rep to Jira and can see it from the Jira side. We added a trigger from “in progress" state to ‘building” state when a branch is created with an issue-key in the branch name.  But when we actually create the branch, nothing happens to the issue. It remains “in progress.” This is true whether we initiate the branch from JIRA or from BitBucket.

Any hints? 

The Jira Agile is emcrbc.atlassian.net … the bitbucket repo is moneyman/git_test.
fields.summary: Trouble linking Jira Agile to Bitbucket (branch create trigger)

fields.description:
When rebasing, resetting or dropping a branch in a Git repo or stripping a commit in a Hg repo will leave behind stale/outdated commit information.

There should be a way to tell the DVCS connector to force a hard resynchronization of the repository. Unchecking and rechecking the repository doesn't do anything. Nor does clicking 'resync'.
fields.summary: There should be a way to remove rebased or stripped commits

fields.description:
We're having an issue with DCVS integration with Github. We have had this configured for quite some time and now all of the sudden we are only able to see public repos and not private repos.

Can you please take a look ASAP ? This is a critcal part of our workflow
fields.summary: Gitub Integration Issues

fields.description:
FYI - [~justen.stepka@atlassian.com] 

Heads up, there appears to be an invalid link to Bitbucket from the Source tab in a given JIRA issue. 

Steps To reproduce:

1) Navigate to https://<instance>.atlassian.net/browse/<any_ticket>
2) Select the "Source" tab under the Activity section at the bottom of the issue.
3) Click the "Configure" button on the Bitbucket section in the center.

When the Configure button is clicked it redirects to:
https://<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ConfigureBitbucketOAuth!default.jspa

Which is an invalid page (see screenshots). I have confirmed this to be the case in two OnDemand instances. 

Please see https://sdog.jira.com/browse/BBC-598

Cheers,
Jason | Atlassian
fields.summary: Invalid Link to Bitbucket from JIRA Source Tab

fields.description:
- Add public repo: "https://github.com/farmas/TestRepo-QA/master " (note trailing white space

*Expected*: Repo to be added

*Actual*: Error message apperars: "Please supply a valid GitHub repository URL"
fields.summary: When adding a repository url should be trimmed for whitespaces

fields.description:
Linker functionality was recently restored to cloud instances however there is now an issue where large numbers of projects can cause linkers to be deleted.

DVCS connector calculates the linkers to install in Bitbucket based on the Projects and commits in the repositories for an account.

If a single repository has many projects and the resulting Regex is greater than 256 characters the linkers will fail to install. The existing linkers will still be deleted however as the delete will still work.

If you run into this issue then please contact support for a workaround.
fields.summary: Linkers in Bitbucket will fail to install if there are too many projects

fields.description:
Just upgraded to 0.30 due to DCON-210.

This fixes the problem with that issue, but now I am seeing a new problem.  If I hit "force sync" for one of our larger projects it always fails with "Sync Failed: API Rate Limit Exceeded for <user-id> (403)".

See here: http://developer.github.com/v3/#rate-limiting

I'm going to contact them to request that my instance be white listed, but I think you need to look at the X-RateLimit-Limit and X-RateLimit-Limit-Remaining headers and throttle your requests appropriately.
fields.summary: Receiving "Sync Failed: API Rate Limit Exceeded for <user-id> (403)" when attempting to add a new project

fields.description:
I just tried to create a new user in my AOD instance. I checked both *Administrator* and *Developer* under my Bitbucket team name "kenstest".

The user was created on the AOD side, but no BB user was created and no email was sent.
fields.summary: AOD Create User fails to create Bitbucket user

fields.description:
In some scenarios DVCS connector is reporting a Rate limit exceeded error in the logs (429) which will look something like:

{code:log}
2015-06-18 07:13:47,461 DVCSConnector.MessageExecutor:thread-1 ERROR      [dvcs.service.message.MessageConsumer] Synchronization failed: Error response code during the request : 429
com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.spi.bitbucket.clientlibrary.request.BitbucketRequestException$Other: Error response code during the request : 429
{code}

When the rate limit for Bitbucket is exceeded - https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Rate+limits

The next sync will carry on from where the previous failed so it will eventually complete but any syncs triggered whilst the rate limit is breached will show this error.
fields.summary: Bitbucket rate limit hit by DVCS connector resulting in 429 response code in the log
Remove AJS from bitbucklet plugin

fields.description:
Currently worklogs are added with a worklog date reflecting the discovery date of the commit, not the original commit date. This ends up in worklogs not being logged at the date a developer acutally commited the change and did the work. Worklogs are placed at the date when the commit got pushed to the remote repository.

It would be really helpful to see the worklogs in reports at the dates when the actual work has been done, not when it has been pushed to the remote repository.
fields.summary: Worklog date for worklogs added by smart commits should be the commit's date

fields.description:
Is it possible that parens in the comment field interfere with subsequent commands on the line? For the following example, one minute of time is logged instead of four hours:

"PDEV-2433: #comment Only hold exclusive lock on network during tunnel server selection, commit when (if) selection changes #time 4h"

This particular user has plenty of commits that successfully update time spent.
fields.summary: parenthesis in commit #comment interferes with #time

fields.description:
Hi,
I am trying to sync all 50 of my repositories from my on-demand instance (vorstack.atlassian.com).  I am able to sink 41 of them.  One of them reports "Sync Failed: Error during sync. See server logs" and the other 8 have been showing "Synchronizing: 0 changesets, 0 pull requests, 0 issues found" for 18 hours+.  

Can you provide me the server logs for my on-demand instance and provide me any information you can about how I can get all my repos syncing.

Thanks,
s
fields.summary: Need on-demand server logs and advice - Got the message "Sync Failed: Error during sync. See server logs"

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*
# Create an issue in JIRA for a project whose DVCS account is linked with a Github repo
# Create a branch in the Github repo from step 1. The branch name must include the JIRA issuekey from step 1
# Open the "1 branch" link in the Development section of the JIRA issue
# Click the "Create Pull Request" link
*Expected:* User is taken to a github page where they can create a pull request for the branch created in step 2 against the repo's master branch (https://github.com/:Organization/:Repository/compare...{{branch_name}})
*Actual:* User is taken to https://github.com/:Organization/:Repository/compare

fields.description:
The GitHub equivalent of a Team in Bitbucket is an Organization in GitHub. This should be clarified when adding a new account on the *Manage DVCS Accounts* page. When selecting GitHub from the list, the label of the field should read *Organization or User Account:*

This slight change in terms can cause unnecessary confusion.

fields.description:
DVCS connector does something odd, selecting {{"ID, *"}} in its queries e.g.
https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/jira-dvcs-connector/src/5a1d55788fa95a2f6b0553bbe229438ddb580877/jira-dvcs-connector-api/src/main/java/com/atlassian/jira/plugins/dvcs/util/ao/QueryTemplate.java?at=master#cl-292

This results in queries that are unparseable with {{limit}} or {{offset}} e.g.
{code}
SELECT
    *
FROM
    (
        SELECT
            queueItem."ID",
            queueItem.*
        FROM
            "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE_QUEUE_ITEM" queueItem
        JOIN
            "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE" MESSAGE
        ON
            QUEUEITEM."MESSAGE_ID" = MESSAGE."ID"
        WHERE
            MESSAGE."ADDRESS" = ?
        AND QUEUEITEM."QUEUE" = ?
        AND QUEUEITEM."STATE" = ?
        ORDER BY
            "MESSAGE"."PRIORITY" DESC ,
            "MESSAGE"."ID" ASC )
WHERE
    ROWNUM <= 1
{code}
fields.summary: Oracle Offset/Limit Queries Failing When "ID, *" Selected

fields.description:
Hi,

I've sent a commit message that was like that
{code}
the message mx-4.5
{code}

The "mx-4.5" was not referring to a JIRA issue, and was actually just a version number for me...
However, the DVCS connector picked-up that message and linked it to the JIRA Issue "MX-4". I assume this happened because "mx-4.5" is a subset of "MX-4".

Is it possible to apply some rules to restrict which issues are linked to JIRA? For example, would it be possible to have commit messages with only upper-case JIRA issue numbers to be synced with JIRA? And also, only commit messages where the JIRA Issue number is "explicit" (example: MX-4 would be picked-up and linked to the MX-4 JIRA Issue, but "emx-4" would not be linked to MX-4?

Thanks,

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If the parent repository of forked repository was deleted and thus the forked repository was marked as disabled in GitHub, it is still returned in the list of repositories but fetching the detailed information (to find out the fork repository information) causes 404 NOT FOUND error. This also occurs if the repository was marked as deleted in Github but never removed from the sync list in DVCS.

You'll see the following stack trace in the logs:
{code:java}
 2016-10-05 18:22:57,501 Caesium-1-2 DEBUG ServiceRunner [c.a.j.p.dvcs.service.RepositoryServiceImpl] Synchronizing list of repositories
 2016-10-05 18:22:57,511 Caesium-1-2 DEBUG ServiceRunner [c.a.j.p.d.d.impl.transform.RepositoryTransformer] Repository transformation: [AO_E8B6CC_REPOSITORY_MAPPING \{ID = 15}] 
 2016-10-05 18:22:57,535 Caesium-1-2 ERROR ServiceRunner [c.a.scheduler.core.JobLauncher] Scheduled job with ID 'com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.scheduler.DvcsScheduler:job' failed
 com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.exception.SourceControlException: Error retrieving list of repositories
 at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.spi.github.GithubCommunicator.getRepositories(GithubCommunicator.java:252)
 at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.service.remote.CachingCommunicator.getRepositories(CachingCommunicator.java:232)
 at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.service.RepositoryServiceImpl.syncRepositoryList(RepositoryServiceImpl.java:219)
 at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.service.RepositoryServiceImpl.syncRepositoryList(RepositoryServiceImpl.java:264)
 at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.scheduler.DvcsSchedulerJobRunner.syncOrganizations(DvcsSchedulerJobRunner.java:67)
 at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.scheduler.DvcsSchedulerJobRunner.runJob(DvcsSchedulerJobRunner.java:55)
 at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.runJob(JobLauncher.java:153)
 at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launchAndBuildResponse(JobLauncher.java:118)
 at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launch(JobLauncher.java:97)
 at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService.launchJob(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:401)
 at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService.executeClusteredJob(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:396)
 at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService.executeQueuedJob(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:349)
 at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService$1.consume(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:255)
 at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService$1.consume(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:252)
 at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.SchedulerQueueWorker.executeJob(SchedulerQueueWorker.java:65)
 at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.SchedulerQueueWorker.executeNextJob(SchedulerQueueWorker.java:59)
 at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.SchedulerQueueWorker.run(SchedulerQueueWorker.java:34)
 at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
 Caused by: org.eclipse.egit.github.core.client.RequestException: Not Found (404)
 at org.eclipse.egit.github.core.client.GitHubClient.createException(GitHubClient.java:552)
 at org.eclipse.egit.github.core.client.GitHubClient.get(GitHubClient.java:740)
 at org.eclipse.egit.github.core.client.PageIterator.next(PageIterator.java:173)
 at org.eclipse.egit.github.core.service.GitHubService.getAll(GitHubService.java:151)
 at org.eclipse.egit.github.core.service.RepositoryService.getRepositories(RepositoryService.java:242)
 ... 17 more

{code}
and this causes the scheduler for DVCS to break so any subsequent syncs of any repos fail
h3. Steps to Diagnose
 # Ensure debug [logging|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Logging+and+Profiling] is enabled for the following package *com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs*
 # Delete the OAuth keys and recreate them using an owner
 # Note the start time
 # Re-add the repository with a user that owns/admins the repository
 # Attempt to add a new repository
 # Grab both Github Enterprise / JIRA Server Logs
 # Compare 404s from *web-logs/github.log* to DVCS Error thrown in logs to find offending repo

h3. Environment
* DVCS 4.0.11

h3. Workaround

Delete forked repository on GitHub, the parent repository doesn't exist anymore, there is no use of such repository, even GitHub treats the repository as disabled. If the repository has already been removed, ensure that DVCS does not make any calls to deleted repository.

Is this something you can help us with on your end?

p.s. Also, please update this error for the OD version of Jira.  Its frustrating to run into error messages addressed to sys admins in a cloud offering.  It would be great if these types of errors had some level of automated ticket creation for your team to look into, rather than putting the onus on the customer to reach out for troubleshooting assistance, especially in the case where an exception requires intervention on your end.

fields.summary: Sync fails with error 'Entities can only be used with a single EntityManager instance'

fields.description:
Our onDemand instance is unable to sync to our large list of repos for our Github organization.  The initial add seemed to work but now all of the repositories are showing the "Sync Failed: Error during sync.  See server logs".  I'm unable to see any server logs since its a cloud/onDemand instance.

After deleting the account thinking there was something wrong with it, I created a new GitHub Application key and tried to re add.  Now I get

[Error retrieving list of repositories]
fields.summary: Can't Sync Entire Organization: "Sync Failed: Error during sync. See server logs." then "[Error retrieving list of repositories]"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-14245].
  {panel}

The OnDemand instance I'm using for this example is: https://simpleltc.atlassian.net

A customer noticed that certain repos that were connected are missing project issue keys in the regex, so these keys do not show as "linked" within Bitbucket commit view. Two examples of these repos:

https://bitbucket.org/simpleltc/lib-infrastructure/admin/links -- (this repo only lists the BAC project regex)

https://bitbucket.org/simpleltc/analyzer-rules/admin/links -- (this repo lists BAC,SUP,WUI,AN projects)

It is my understanding that these regex values should contain ALL of the projects. I've disabled the repo under 'DVCS Accounts' and re-enabled, but it still shows only one project for the lib-infrastructure repo. This behavior seems very inconsistent.
fields.summary: JIRA issue key regex is inconsistent across Bitbucket repos

fields.summary: Incorrect branch associated with the commit displayed on "Source" tab

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-14242].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
# create a pull request with source from branch A and destination to branch B (suppose the commits to be merged contain issue key ABC-123)
# synchronize the repository so that the commits to be merged are recorded and the PR is associated with issue ABC-123 on the Development panel
# update the pull request to change destination to branch C, so that the commits with issue key ABC-123 are no longer in the list to be merged
# synchronize the repository
# result
#* expected: the PR is disassociated with the issue ABC-123.
#* actual: the PR is still associated with the issue ABC-123.

*Workaround*: Do a full synchronization on the affected repository from the "DVCS Accounts" page.
fields.summary: Pull requests are associated with incorrect issues after destination is changed

This is related to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/DCON-43.

When syncing, request my return with "400 Bad Request" or other error messages. Currently this will cause an unhandled JSON exception and the result is that the sync status contains both success and error messages.

We should advice the user that the sync failed partially and that a resync is recommended.

However, if committing messages using command line, it still works.
fields.summary: Commit Message in TortoiseHG Not Getting Parsed to JIRA Issues

fields.description:
Forking is encouraged in Bitbucket as an easy way to make feature branches (outside of Git itself), creating duplicates of Repositories.

However, every time a Repo is forked, every smart commit within is processed again in JIRA (likely because it's technically a new repo). If you make smart commits within your fork, then merge them back into the master, every smart commit is processed once more. 

* Steps to reproduce
# Create a new Repository
# Enable Smart commits for your entire team account (and auto add smart commits for new Repos)
# Fork your repo and work in the new fork (all of these should remain under the team account)
# Commit to the Repo with a smart commit, log some time
** This smart commit will now properly be registered in JIRA
# Merge into your master branch
** This will re-process the smart commit made in the fork
# Fork again
** Your commit will now be processed AGAIN.
# There are now 3 comments and 3 times the work logged against a single issue.

Because Forking is encouraged in Bitbucket, this behaviour causes trouble in JIRA as multiple work logs are added and people who use JIRA for reporting can get confused.
fields.summary: Forking in Bitbucket with Smart commits enabled causes double/multiple entries
ERROR  [dvcs.service.message.MessageConsumer] Synchronization failed: Could not get changeset

fields.description:
The functionality is described at https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Configure+Automatic+Team+Invites.

*Issue*: 'Developers' group is added to a newly created organization as default group and thus all newly created JIRA users are automatically invited to the group if the group exists on Bitbucket.

*Expected solution*: The group should be added for OnDemand instances and only for integrated accounts but not for BTF instances.

*Workaround:*
# Go to DVCS Accounts page 
# Choose Configure automatic access for the corresponding organization
# Uncheck the Developers group if present
# Press Save button

fields.description:
When configuring GIT DVCS connection you are able to enter a URL mismatch in the Git account connection while generating the OAuth tokens.
h3.Reproduce
   - registered JIRA DVCS on github, and entered the wrong callback url, per the documentation [HERE | https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Linking+a+Bitbucket+or+GitHub+repository+with+JIRA+OnDemand] (See Screenshot)
  - this allows you to enter the incorrect information without error
   - Then when configuring the DVCS on JIRA, at step 2 point 10 per the documentation, click "add"
   - Because the callback address was wrong, github signalled an error.
   - *Error*: Blank page is returned with an error similar to:
{code}
https://not_a_correct_url.atlassian.net/?error=redirect_uri_mismatch&error_description=The+redirect_uri+MUST+match+the+registered+callback+URL+for+this+application.&error_uri=https%3A%2F%2Fdeveloper.github.com%2Fv3%2Foauth%2F%23redirect-uri-mismatch
{code}
NOTE: https://not_a_correct_url.atlassian.net/? from the example above will be the misconfigured *Authorization callback URL* from your GIT settings

h3.Workaround
Confirm that the *Homepage URL* and the *Authorization callback URL* are the same, and are your Base URL
exe: 
Correct:
 - Homepage URL: https://example.atlassian.net
 - Authorization callback UR: https://example.atlassian.net

Incorrect:
 - https://example.atlassian.net/secure/Dashboard.jspa
fields.summary: Entering mismatched URL for GIT causes error

fields.description:

See the attached screen shot from Bitbucket showing check-ins to two repos, with the same JIRA issue at the head of the commit message, but only one has the link to the JIRA issue and JIRA only shows one of the commits.

This is a major problem.  We have a JIRA project for testing a product and it covers the test environment (in one repo) and the test scripts (in another repo).

fields.description:
When there is a branch whose name is the sha of one of the contained commits this creates a cycle in the branch traversal algorithm, causing the DVCS connector synchronisation for that branch to loop infinitely.

Here is an example from https://github.com/ahalife/django-mediasync

{code}
* commit fa6a134cf4fe7b57ba2143a88ae489d4af735129 (origin/8b09e8b1f5faa83f71721b5ef97f424813e312ff)
| Author: jcarbaugh <jcarbaugh@gmail.com>
| Date:   Mon Sep 28 01:29:32 2009
| 
|     Updated README examples to use the default long paths instead of the JS/CSS path shortcuts.
|  
* commit 8b09e8b1f5faa83f71721b5ef97f424813e312ff
| Author: Jeremy Carbaugh <jcarbaugh@gmail.com>
| Date:   Sat Sep 26 07:44:33 2009
| 
|     base URL config on MEDIA_URL setting
|  
{code}

The issue here is that the [GitHub commits API|https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/commits/#get-a-single-commit] interprets the {{:sha}} path parameter as a sha *or* a branch name so when the DVCS connector requests sha={{8b09e8b}} GitHub actually returns commit {{fa6a134}} (the head of the branch called {{8b09e8b1f5faa83f71721b5ef97f424813e312ff}}). The sync algorithm then goes on to fetch the parent of {{fa6a134}}, which is {{8b09e8b}}, and the cycle repeats.
fields.summary: Branch name equal to commit sha on GitHub causes infinite loop in synchronisation

fields.description:
This feels like a race condition. I was able to repro it in two different ways, producing slightly different stack traces, but the core problem seems to be when loading the configure page and we are in the middle of adding a new repro.

1. 
- Create project "QA" and "TST"
- Add 1 issue to each project
- Open a new browser window and navigate to configure repositories page.
- On one browser window, add public repo: "https://github.com/farmas/TestRepo-QA" to project "QA"
- On a separate browser window, add public repo: "https://github.com/farmas/TestRepo-TST" to project "TST"

*Expected*: a) Both repos to complete their syncs, b) Second add to fail stating that there is already a sync operation under way.

*Actual*: The second add operation shows an un-handled error to the client

2. 
While adding a new repo, on the second window keep changing between the oauth view and the repositories view.
fields.summary: Error is rendered on page when loading configure repositories page and repo is being added concurrently

fields.description:
h3. The problem:
While configuring Github integration, the setup screen returns "_error obtain access token_" as in the following screenshots:
!DVCS_1.png|thumbnail!
!DVCS_2.png|thumbnail!

The following appears on {{atlassian-jira.log}}:
{noformat}
2014-04-08 10:32:45,944 http-bio-8622-exec-15 WARN admin 632x331x1 1ycok0n 192.168.10.136 /secure/admin/AddGithubOrganization!finish.jspa [spi.github.webwork.AddGithubOrganization] Error obtaining access token. Cannot access https://github.com from Jira.
2014-04-08 10:32:45,944 http-bio-8622-exec-15 WARN admin 632x331x1 1ycok0n 192.168.10.136 /secure/admin/AddGithubOrganization!finish.jspa [spi.github.webwork.AddGithubOrganization] Caused by: https://github.com/login/oauth/access_token
{noformat}

h3. Current behavior:
If you click "_Try Again_" it redirects you to Github 404 page. If you click "_Cancel_" you see that the integration is set, but not all repositories appear on the list.

The only way to get the full repositories list is by selecting "_Refresh list_" as in the screenshot bellow:
!DVCS_3.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected behavior:
The setup screen should complete the operation without any error and the list of repositories should be display without the need to select "_Refresh list_".
fields.summary: Error obtaining access token while configuring Github integration
